content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 14 Aug 2019Can someone teach me how returns are calculated for Philip unit trust rsp (Annualised return: 2.76%)?Iâ€™m investing in Philip unit trust RSP $200 per month ... Started in 12/10/2018 portfolio value: 8,145.61..total contribution: 7,800. Monthly return: 1.23%, year to date return: 6.75%. ?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 20 Aug 2019So you've invested 11 months. Started with 5.6k and added 2.2k over the period?That's 5.589% p.a yield.
Present Value: 5600Payment: 200Future Value: 8145.61Periods: 11 MonthsAnnual Rate %: 5.5890 comments3

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 18 Aug 2019Look at the net gain or loss versus the amount you contributed. In this case, there is a gain of $345.61 over the contributed amount of $7,800. Returns is about 4.43% since October 2018. Not exactly fantastic since unit trusts do have a lot of fees involved... Do take note that fees are payable regardless of fund performance0 comments0
